div.span: Adapted from Inventory of Greek Coin Hoards

div.pre: 217 Argos, 1924 (65) Burial: early 2nd cent. B.C. (Hackens) Contents: 217+ AE Antigonus Doson: 1 Megara: 1 Sicyon: 1 Argos: 214 Disposition: Athens 55 (53 Argos, 1 Sicyon, 1 Antigonus). An additional 48 Argive bronzes received at about the same time "from another source" may belong to the same find Welch, NC 1924, pp. 318-20. (The Antigonus and Sicyon coins, although not recorded by Welch, came to Athens with the Argos pieces)
